items.sentence: I\'m beginning to understand why you don\'t bother to try to explain things to Tom.
I\'ve had a slight sore throat since this morning. I wonder if I\'ve caught a cold.
It\'ll take longer to tell you how to do it than to just go ahead and do it myself.
Many parents think it\'s important for their children to learn how to speak French.
The more time you spend talking about what you do, the less time you have to do it.
Tom started studying French when he was a child, so his pronunciation is very good.
Even though Tom explained it in detail, I\'m still not sure I really understand it.
I know what time you said to be there, but I wasn\'t able to be there at that time.
Even though Tom didn\'t want to, he was too polite not to invite Mary to his party.
I\'d like to buy the car you\'re selling, but I don\'t have enough money right now.
I never for a moment imagined I\'d be able to afford to live in such a fancy house.
Tom certainly gave the impression that he wasn\'t planning on being there tomorrow.
Tom knew that Mary couldn\'t swim, but he asked her to go swimming with him anyway.
The teacher wrote something on the blackboard, but it was too small for me to read.
Tom asked Mary to pick up some toothpaste and some toilet paper at the supermarket.
All the teachers and students we talked to said that Tom is easy to get along with.
The police searched Tom\'s house for three hours, but they couldn\'t find anything.
Tom couldn\'t completely rule out the possibility that he was going to get drafted.
Tom couldn\'t think of Mary without remembering how painful their breakup had been.
Tom believes that Mary made a big mistake when she sold her father\'s Stradivarius.
Tom contacted me the other day asking me if I\'d play guitar for a charity concert.
Tom decided to try trimming his beard with a knife, but he wasn\'t very successful.
Tom didn\'t buy anything at that store because he thought the prices were too high.
Tom doesn\'t think there is any advantage of doing it the way you suggest we do it.
My grandmother used to use her sewing machine a lot up until about three years ago.
All I can think about is next month\'s vacation. I haven\'t been on one in so long.
Since I was carrying a suitcase in each hand, I pushed the door open with my elbow.
Tom thought that he had woken up from his dream, but in fact he was still dreaming.
When you compare this dictionary with that one, you can easily see which is better.
Tom wanted Mary to talk to John about the problem she was having with his children.
Tom was sentenced to five days in jail and a year on probation for drunken driving.
We could probably make more money if we lowered the price since we could sell more.
When I was in school, left-handed kids were forced to write with their right hands.
I don\'t want to be the one who tells Tom that Mary died in an automobile accident.
I\'m sure you\'re aware that you\'ll be the only one there who can\'t speak French.
The reason Tom is fat is because he eats too much and doesn\'t get enough exercise.
Tom says that he can\'t remember anything that happened on the day of the accident.
Tom certainly should be careful not to make Mary angry when she\'s holding a knife.
Tom says that someday he\'ll be able to play the English horn as well as Mary does.
I can remember some faces, but there are some people here I don\'t remember seeing.
Tom is doing everything within his power to improve the patients\' quality of life.
Tom became tired of always having to pay the bill every time he went out with Mary.
Tom certainly looked and sounded better than he did last month when we visited him.
Tom looked at his watch and saw that he only had five minutes left until lunchtime.
Tom works as a bank clerk during the week and as a part-time lifeguard on weekends.
I still have a lot of questions I want to ask you about your relationship with Tom.
The restaurant owner allowed her to take table scraps home to feed all of her dogs.
There is a sewing machine and an ironing board in the room where Tom used to sleep.
Tom doesn\'t want Mary to say anything to John about seeing Alice with another man.
Tom\'s trip turned into a nightmare when his passport and credit cards were stolen.
